DataElement.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Clinical Study Biopsy Participation Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator of a patient's consent for SWOG biopsy participation in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the biopsy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Clinical Study Biopsy Participation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the Southwest Oncology Group, an NCI-sponsored adult cancer clinical trials organization, patient's consent to systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, to establish or revise a theory, or to develop a plan of action based on the biopsy._The act of taking part in an activity._Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) is an NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: An NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.:The act of taking part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
The act of taking part in an activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.
